name: electronic component factory construction | electronic component factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8520/documentation

This dataset represents the production site for the production of electronic components. It is based on information from AMD’s Fab36 in Dresden, Saxony (Germany), supported/extended by literature and/or assumptions. The production site is taken as representative for all production plants due to the fact, that components are produced in clean rooms. A total life-span of 25 years is assumed. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From unknown land use forseen for production site for production of electronics components.

This module includes land use, buildings and facilities (machinery, cables, etc.) as well as the respective disposal activities of a microprocessor production site, used as example for a electronic component plant.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module relates to the global situation.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The AMD site in Saxony is taken as representative of a typical electronic components plant.

exchanges.description:
Within the electronics industry, a huge variety of different types of plants - responsible for different production steps; and thus supposed to contain different equipment - can be distinguished. 
This plant is mainly based on information from AMD’s Fab36 in Dresden, Saxony (Germany) producing microprocessors. It is taken as representative for all production plants due to the fact, that also “simpler” active and passive components (e.g. resistors, transistors, diodes, etc.) have to be produced in clean rooms.

flow.name: Transformation, to industrial area

exchanges.description: Estimation, conservative estimation based on literature. For the  process steps in the production chain of semiconductors and other electronic components100 units are requested with a life-span of 10 years - i.e. 2.5 times the amount  estimated is needed. Hence, an input of 250 times is taken into account per Fab.
